text:
Hi, I'm working on an email and used the preview window for outlook and its not displaying the margin on my images, so all the images are sat side by side. Does anyone have a work around for this?
I have tried using the hspace and vspace but this still hasn't worked
Using the drag and drop editor fixes most Outlook issues for me. Is this in the editor or coded?

Bumping this question: Is there a way to hide the "don't use style tags warning" in the drag and drop email editor? I think this use is valid (because it strips out the <style> tags and inlines the code:
```<style type="text/css" 
  data-hse-inline-css="true">```
can I load it as a "linked file" maybe? would it be an html file with a `<style>` tag?
Most email clients don’t support external CSS files so you can’t do that.
raw code, as its an element

Just to clarify, that `style` tag is added to an email module. From what I can tell, HubSpot compiles that module and inlines the styles. That all works, but you still get a warning for having a style tag—I'm hoping to remove that warning.
<@U02052679KJ> It might be worth duplicating it in the drag and drop editor and then copying the generated code from the preview.
thats a good idea, ill look into that! Thanks <@UDHT6N5SM>
